event_description:
In the upcoming MLB game, scheduled for September 17 at 7:40PM ET:
If the Los Angeles Angels win, the market will resolve to “Angels”.
If the Milwaukee Brewers win, the market will resolve to “Brewers”.
If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.
If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.
To know when a postponed game will be played, please check the home team's schedule on MLB.com for the listed team and look for the game described as a makeup game.

decision.rationale: The game has concluded with a final score of Brewers 9, Angels 2, per MLB.com Gameday and ESPN box score/recap. The combined runs = 11, which is strictly greater than 7.5, so the correct resolution is Over. The market still shows Over at 0.82 as of 2025-09-18, implying settlement risk or stale pricing, creating clear positive EV. Given official MLB data confirms the outcome, I estimate the true probability at ~100%. Skipping other markets as allocating all capital to the highest EV (Over at ~18% edge) dominates alternatives (Brewers -1.5 at ~15% edge; NRFI Yes at ~0.45% edge; ML Brewers at ~3.55% edge).

market_investment_decisions.market_question: Los Angeles Angels vs. Milwaukee Brewers: O/U 7.5
